course.name: Rust Course
course.description: Interactive Rust programming course based on The Rust Programming Language book, covering ownership, traits, concurrency, and capstone projects.
course.status: Coming soon — content is being written

modules.title: Rust Quick Reference
modules.description: Installation, cargo commands, common errors, and quick lookup reference.

modules.title: Hello World & Guessing Game
modules.description: Your first Rust program, cargo basics, and building a number guessing game.

modules.title: Common Programming Concepts
modules.description: Variables, mutability, data types, functions, and control flow in Rust.

modules.title: Understanding Ownership
modules.description: Ownership rules, borrowing, references, and the slice type. Rust's core innovation.

modules.title: Using Structs
modules.description: Defining and instantiating structs, method syntax, and associated functions.

modules.title: Enums & Pattern Matching
modules.description: Defining enums, the Option type, and exhaustive pattern matching with match.

modules.title: Packages, Crates & Modules
modules.description: Organizing code with packages, crates, modules, and the use keyword.

modules.title: Common Collections
modules.description: Vectors, strings, and hash maps — Rust's most-used collection types.

modules.title: Error Handling
modules.description: Recoverable errors with Result, unrecoverable errors with panic!, and the ? operator.

modules.title: Generic Types, Traits & Lifetimes
modules.description: Generics for code reuse, traits for shared behavior, and lifetimes for reference validity.

modules.title: Writing Automated Tests
modules.description: Writing tests, running tests, and test organization in Rust.

modules.title: Iterators & Closures
modules.description: Closures as anonymous functions, iterator adaptors, and functional patterns.

modules.title: Cargo & Crates.io
modules.description: Release profiles, publishing crates, workspaces, and cargo install.

modules.title: Smart Pointers
modules.description: Box, Rc, RefCell, and building your own smart pointers.

modules.title: Fearless Concurrency
modules.description: Threads, message passing with channels, and shared-state concurrency with Mutex.

modules.title: OOP Features of Rust
modules.description: Trait objects, the dyn keyword, and object-oriented patterns in Rust.

modules.title: Patterns & Matching
modules.description: All the places patterns can be used, refutability, and pattern syntax.

modules.title: Advanced Features
modules.description: Unsafe Rust, advanced traits, advanced types, macros, and FFI.

projects.title: CLI Grep Tool (minigrep)
projects.description: Build a command-line search tool. Applies concepts from modules on error handling, ownership, and iterators. Based on TRPL Chapter 12.

projects.title: Multithreaded Web Server
projects.description: Build a multithreaded web server from scratch. Applies concurrency, smart pointers, and trait objects. Based on TRPL Chapter 20.
